Job Posting:174198 - Position: W26 Student, Business Analyst, Application Delivery (8-months) 174198B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 10/17/2025 11:00 PM Through Employer Website 10/07/2025 03:32 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Alberta Investment Management Corporation (AIMCO) 100 King Street West, Suite 5 First Canadian Place Toronto M5X 1B1 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION 2026 - Winter W26 Student, Business Analyst, Application Delivery (8-months) 174198B Co-op Position Edmonton or Calgary, AB Canada 8 months CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description Job Req: JR100697 Opportunity AIMCo's Application Delivery team is responsible for executing large-scale projects to support AIMCo's growth. The team collaborates with various departments within the organization to provide strategic solutions for a wide range of functions, including public and private investments, Investment Finance, middle/back office, and more. As a member of the Application Delivery team, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge financial technology (Fintech) applications in the asset management industry. This will allow you to gain expertise in the investment industry, the latest financial technologies (FINTECH), and project management. Your role will be crucial in ensuring that the deliverables meet business needs. Note: This is an 8-month, full-time term from January 2026 through August 2026 Responsibilities Include: • Working closely with agile Application Delivery teams to implement projects and change initiatives • Participating in implementation projects by configuring, documenting, and presenting accounting functionality throughout the project life-cycle • Preparing project artifacts and assisting in documenting business processes and test regression suites. • Utilizing business analysis tools and techniques to support enterprise-wide initiatives, identifying workflow issues, and implementing innovative solutions. • Facilitating requirements gathering sessions with subject matter experts to create and validate system specifications that meet business requirements. Success Measures: As a successful student, you will look back on your time at AIMCo's Application Delivery team and be proud of how much you have learned and grown as an aspiring professional. You will have developed a strong understanding of the different business units within AIMCo and collaborated on building data pipelines to improve collaboration and transparency through knowledge transfer and effective communication, leveraging modern data development tools. You will learn about problem-solving and be expected to try to solve your own issues before seeking guidance from your team members. This position is open to candidates who are willing to relocate to Alberta, and we encourage all interested individuals to apply. Final candidates will be asked to undergo a security screening, which includes a credit bureau and a criminal record investigation, the results of which must be acceptable to AIMCo. ALERT - Be on the lookout for AIMCo career opportunities advertised through third parties that request an application fee or too much information. To verify, all opportunities are posted on aimco.ca/jobs At AIMCo, we draw upon the differences in who we are, where we come from and the way we think to deliver results for the Albertans who rely on us. We offer an inclusive, modern workplace where well-being is prioritized, and colleagues are enabled to do their best work. Our team members are motivated by our purpose and committed to creating long-term value for our clients and their beneficiaries. Job Requirements Our Ideal Candidate Qualifications: • Currently enrolled in undergraduate studies in Business or Quantitative programs (Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.) • Returning to studies immediately following the work term or completing final work experience terms • Ability to gather business requirements by liaising with subject matter experts, including knowledge of investment operations. • Experience with Agile Scrum/Kanban processes, and work management tools: Azure DevOps, Mural, Confluence • Proficiency with programming language(s) and or Database Technologies (e.g. Python, SQL, XML, XSLT, MS SQL Server, Oracle, C#, JQuery, CSS, HTML) is desirable • Keen interest in the financial markets and strong understanding of financial concepts, practices, and tools. • Exceptional research?and problem-solving abilities • Demonstrates a strong commitment to AIMCo's core values of excellence, transparency, humility, integrity and collaboration, and inspires the same in others Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions ***Job Posting will expire at 11:59pm MT on October 17, 2025 Next Steps We are excited to meet you. Please submit your resume or CV to be considered for this opportunity. Applications are being reviewed on a rolling basis and we will be in touch with any questions. Application Link: https://aimco.wd10.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/AIMCoCareers/job/Edmonton/Student--Business-Analyst-- Application-Delivery--8-months-_JR100697?source=LinkedIn Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
